  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap on one of the bottles came loose and an internal leakage resulted. Once the package was found it was brought to QA to be worked on. DescribePack: The cap on the bottle was loose and the contents were eating through the box (due to their corrosive nature) DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Item was placed in a spill tote to minimize spillage

Report X-2023061558

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was notified by a manager that the outer packaging was wet. We secured the packaging in a lined red tote and tightened the cap. DescribePack: Cap became loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote and caps were tightened.

item.title: Report X-2023061523
item.description:
Report X-2023061523

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler placed the hazmat upside down causing the closure to begin to leak. The manager noticed the leaking hazmat and called QA. We used neutralizer to clean up the spilled product. We secured the package and the soiled clean up materials in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Package was placed upside down causing the cap to leak DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed upright and the cap was tightened

item.title: Report X-2023061522
item.description:
Report X-2023061522

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was loaded behind trailer door, once opened at NOKY it fell and began to leak. QA cleaned up the spilled product with absorbent pads, we secured the package and soiled clean up materials in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Cap became loose due to falling out of the trailer DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote and caps were tightened

item.title: Report X-2023061514
item.description:
Report X-2023061514

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to a newly opened trailer, package was found with entire top ripped open and wet. No liquid on floor of trailer or on other packages. Package was put into a lined tote. DescribePack: Both bottles of solution in package were missing caps and caps were not found in package. Appears product leaked before it was loaded due to no obvious spill in trailer. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a lined tote.

item.title: Report E-2023060794
item.description:
Report E-2023060794

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-05
  • City: HOLMES MILL
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ERGON TRUCKING, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Traveling southwest on KY-38, MM24-25, Tractor and Trailer dropped off narrow berm of road and rolled over embankment into creek. The rollover resulted in rupturing the shell of the trailer and releasing approximately 113 bbls. of crude oil into ditch/creek. A rock in the creek is believed to be what punctured the shell of the aluminum trailer. Kentucky Emergency Response Branch as well as Kentucky Department of Environmental Protection were notified immediately. Contract Spill Response/Cleanup company (EcoTech Environmental USA) was contacted with a response time of roughly two hours. Onsite EMS services responded by inserting a wooden wedge plug into the shell of trailer along with a putty sealant to slow the leakage of product. Kentucky Emergency Management Report #20232450 Kentucky Department of Environmental Protection #2518189

item.title: Report X-2023061489
item.description:
Report X-2023061489

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-19T21:09:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-19
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler laid the drum on its side unloading it from the trailer. They noticed it leaking and notified the manager. Qa was called and we cleaned up the liquid with neutralizer then secured the soiled clean up materials and leaking drum in a lined red tote. DescribePack: The drum began to leak due to being laid on its side. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote.

item.title: Report E-2023060735
item.description:
Report E-2023060735

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-18T15:09:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-09
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 9, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint fell during transit and released its entire contents to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized universal absorbent pads to remediate the paint-impacted surfaces. One (1) 55-gallon drum of spent absorbents and cleanup debris was generated during cleanup and taken for transport and disposal.
